answerText: Death of a Naturalist[10] Death of a Naturalist is by this Irish writer also known for his collection Door into the Dark and his 1999 translation of Beowulf.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 4 | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The titular poem of this collection sees the narrator run away from a flax-dam after seeing bullfrogs sitting "poised like mud grenades" who were "gathered there for vengeance." For 10 points each: [10] Name this collection of poems which ends with the poem "Personal Helicon" and includes a reflection on the death of the author's brother, "Mid-Term Break".
